text: This looks like a really possible, cool, and obtainable solution to the <#C6A044SQH|helpdesk> problem <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/bridging-slacks-helpdesk-and-discourse-proposal-feedback-welcome/53554?u=thecedarprince> <@UGR3910CQ> and all are actively looking for feedback!

attachments.title: Bridging Slack's #Helpdesk and Discourse (Proposal, feedback welcome!)
attachments.text: Hey all, following up on this proposal: #Helpdesk channel on Slack (proposal to close the channel) and a thread here: I’ve heard a number of people say Julia is not mainstream because it doesn’t have many stackoverflow questions answered but they don’t know about discourse, I decided to work actively on these ideas to look into bridging Slack and Discourse. It turns out that it is indeed possible and pretty straightforward. I setup some integrations with Zapier (and previously made a version wi...
attachments.fallback: JuliaLang: Bridging Slack's #Helpdesk and Discourse (Proposal, feedback welcome!)

elements.text: This looks like a really possible, cool, and obtainable solution to the
and all are actively looking for feedback!

text: IMHO, it would be better for people to post to SO. Sure it is commercial but unlike the slack it is very well indexed by google (and has a cool text interface!)

elements.text: IMHO, it would be better for people to post to SO. Sure it is commercial but unlike the slack it is very well indexed by google (and has a cool text interface!)

text: Yeah, our SO has been growing but most folks prefer discourse to Stack overflow

elements.text: Yeah, our SO has been growing but most folks prefer discourse to Stack overflow

text: Stack over flow mods also control the platform vs on discourse, we get to do what we want and be inclusive

elements.text: Stack over flow mods also control the platform vs on discourse, we get to do what we want and be inclusive

text: SO is mostly great, but it can be kind of unfriendly to newcomers or non-fluent English speakers. There is a higher expectation of askers to more clearly lay out a specific question.

elements.text: SO is mostly great, but it can be kind of unfriendly to newcomers or non-fluent English speakers. There is a higher expectation of askers to more clearly lay out a specific question.

text: <@UGR3910CQ> but it wouldn’t be too hard to get some of the julia crew to be mods. <@U6795JH6H> <@U8JAMQGQY> have mad reputation on SO
